title: Freedom of Trade, Commerce, and Intercourse in India (Part XIII of the Constitution)

information.title: Constitutional Provisions
information.description: Part XIII of the Indian Constitution (Articles 301-307) deals with the freedom of trade, commerce, and intercourse within the territory of India.

information.title: Freedom of Trade (Article 301)
information.description: Article 301 declares that trade, commerce, and intercourse throughout the territory of India shall be free. This ensures economic unity and common market across the country.

information.title: Power of Parliament (Article 302)
information.description: Parliament can impose restrictions on the freedom of trade, commerce, and intercourse between one state and another, or within any part of the territory of India, in public interest.

information.title: State's Power (Article 304)
information.description: States can impose reasonable restrictions on the freedom of trade, commerce, and intercourse with other states for public interest. However, a bill for this purpose needs the previous sanction of the President.

information.title: Discriminatory Taxes (Article 304(a))
information.description: States cannot impose any tax discriminating between goods imported from other states and similar goods manufactured or produced within the state.

information.title: Restrictions on Trade (Article 304(b))
information.description: States can impose reasonable restrictions on the freedom of trade, commerce, or intercourse with or within that state in public interest.

information.title: Saving of Existing Laws (Article 305)
information.description: Existing laws and laws providing for state monopolies are saved from the operation of provisions of Article 301.

information.title: Power of President (Article 307)
information.description: The President may appoint an authority to carry out the purposes of Articles 301, 302, 303, and 304.

quizQuestions.question: Which part of the Indian Constitution deals with the freedom of trade, commerce, and intercourse?
Which Article declares that trade, commerce, and intercourse throughout the territory of India shall be free?
Under which Article can Parliament impose restrictions on the freedom of trade and commerce?
Which Article allows states to impose reasonable restrictions on trade and commerce?
What does Article 304(a) prohibit?
options: Discriminatory taxes between goods imported from other states and similar goods produced within the state
Freedom of trade within a state
quizQuestions.correctAnswer: Discriminatory taxes between goods imported from other states and similar goods produced within the state
